intro: Neomammillaria johnstonii var. sancarlensis, commonly known as the Johnston's moon cactus, is a rare and unique cactus species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its striking appearance. The plant features a thick, ribbed stem with a distinctive white or pale green coloration. It produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in the wild.
